origination.label: Creator

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: Series 1: Audio recordings. Series 2: Video recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual recordings of conferences, seminars, symposia, and NCUSCR programs, events and exhanges.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center recognizes that our audiovisual materials may contain problematic language and/or content.

The films, videos, and/or sound in this collection have not been altered in any way. All titles and/or content are illustrative of the creator's original vision. As such, this audiovisual collection may contain discriminatory visual and/or aural content that is representative of racial, gendered, or ableist biases.

Accompanying description, most often with creator or donor-generated language and terminology, has to this point been retained and maintained "as received" by RAC with minimal archivist intervention or augmentation.
We acknowledge these problems and aim to cultivate inclusive representation and equity by reconsidering and enhancing our description of this audiovisual material with current sensibilities.

did.unittitle: Audio Recordings
did.materialspec: All items are 1/4 inch audio tape unless otherwise noted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
Arrangement
arrangement.p: Tapes have been minimally arranged chronologically by date of creation.

odd.head: General
odd.p: All titles are currently based on original container annotations.

did.unittitle: China Conversations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The China Conversations tape program was an early National Committee project. From 1967 to 1975 (or later), staff member Arlene Posner conducted interviews with China scholars, journalists, recent visitors, and other individuals knowledgeable on China or U. S. – China relations. The half-hour recordings cover topics ranging from family life, health, education, agriculture, medicine, and culture, to the political situation and China's foreign relations. The series contained at least 28 titles, which were available for loan to schools, radio stations, or other outlets, or were packaged and distributed by educational publishers.
Some of the recordings carry approximate dates, as some interviews were reissued. For several interviews there is both a "long" version and an abbreviated, "short" version of the recording.

did.unittitle: Conversations from Wingspread

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conversations from Wingspread was a series of half-hour audio conversations with scholars and specialists on various subjects, which in the case of the NCUSCR collection pertain specifically to China and U.S. – China relations.
Moderated by Dan Price, the programs often addressed topics that similarly formed the subject of conferences at the Johnson Foundation's Wingspread Conference Center, in Racine, WI.
The individual programs were numbered; the notes include the recording number (e.g., R-3) when it is known.

did.unittitle: Conferences, Seminars, Lectures, and Meetings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains recorded proceedings of several National Committee conferences and seminars, including its 1969 Convocation on the U.S. and China, some of its early seminars for journalists, and various conferences held at the Johnson Foundation's Wingspread Conference Center. It also includes recordings of a few NCUSCR members meetings, annual addresses, and various other lectures or talks. In addition, the subseries contains the recording of a 1973 education delegation's meetings in China, as well as briefing meetings for the State Education Leaders delegation in 1977-1978.

did.unittitle: Premier Zhu Rongji Speech (Voice of America)
did.physdesc: 56 minutes. There is a brief interruption in the recording at around 46 minutes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 of 1. Dinner in honor of Premier Zhu Rongji, in Washington, DC. Cosponsored by the NCUSCR, the America-China Society, the Asia Society, the Committee of 100, the Council on Foreign Relations, the U. S. - China Policy Foundation, and the U. S. Chamber of Commerce. Address delivered in Chinese, with translation into English.
The recording cuts off abruptly at the end (during a question and answer period).

did.unittitle: United States - China Dialogues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The United States - China Dialogues were initiated in 1984 by the National Committee and the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs, as a way of facilitating frank and productive discussion of sensitive issues between the two countries. Dialogues I-XI (1984-2002) met alternately in the U.S. and China.

did.unittitle: America - China Society
Video Recordings

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual recordings of conferences, seminars, symposia, and NCUSCR programs, events, and exchanges. Some Chinese films and television broadcasts are also included. The series notably includes recordings of Ussuri Project meetings, 1993-1995; videos documenting teacher exchanges and instruction in U.S. and Chinese schools; the U.S. Foreign Policy Colloquium, 2003; and the U.S. visit of the Chinese Table Tennis delegation in 1972.
